name: places/ChIJvT0YnpxZwokR5HGDhdM13D4
formattedAddress: 1553 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1553 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA

editorialSummary.text: Popular bakeshop known for its signature carrot cake, plus various other from-scratch cakes & pies.

originalText.text: I stopped by to pick up a velvet cake.  Three weeks ago we picked up a carrot cake and a slice of the velvet cake which was delicious !   It was moist and the frosting sweet and delicious.  The carrot cake was good but not the best carrot cake I have had.  So we decided to order a whole  red velvet cake.   Maybe like other reviews they were having an off day, or the volume of the cakes for the holidays but this red velvet cake was not moist at all! .  I was really disappointed .   I think the problem is consistency in following recipes and attention to detail of the final product.  Attached is a picture of the red velvet cake , in this case i was not bringing it to a gathering or party it was for home ,  but a bakery should not be proud to give a customer a cake like this.   The frosting was delicious and that makes this cake enjoyable .  To some frosting may be too sweet.   I will still try another slice of velvet if I am ever in the area as that slice of red velvet cake I tried a few weeks back was delicious !  Too bad this time it was not the case.

originalText.text: Hands down the best carrot cake in the world (with nuts and raisins)! We rode over with bikes from Central Park and got a great cup of black coffee from JandJ food market right next door, to pair well with the cake, no way we could wait, so we ate it right outside the store!

text.text: Hands down the best carrot cake in the world (with nuts and raisins)! We rode over with bikes from Central Park and got a great cup of black coffee from JandJ food market right next door, to pair well with the cake, no way we could wait, so we ate it right outside the store!

originalText.text: I’m not gonna lie, I popped by here because I’m pretty sure my man hired a PI to follow me around cause he thinks I’m cheating. I mean, I am, but that’s none of his business. Anyway, I entered this store to throw the PI off my tracks and decided I might as well try some of their carrot cake and their strawberry layer cake. Legit bussing. So good. It made me consider ending my affair, but once I was done eating it, there was a hole in my heart from how delicious the cakes were, so alas I continued on with my affair.

originalText.text: I love this place, I grew up on these cakes. Thanksgivings at Grammys house was always worth the wait. Tht day we cleaned those plates just to get some cake. My son is a repeat visitor to get a slice

text.text: I love this place, I grew up on these cakes. Thanksgivings at Grammys house was always worth the wait. Tht day we cleaned those plates just to get some cake. My son is a repeat visitor to get a slice

originalText.text: After passing by this place multiple times I finally decided to give them a chance, after seeing a positive rating of this place and decent foot traffic in and out of the establishment one would assume this would be a good place to get its name sake. This was not the case, I picked up a carrot cake and a red velvet cake and yo my surprise both were pretty mid on my honest opinion. I'm not sure if this was an off day for them but the velvet cake was bland as so was the carrot cake. The cakes were both moist so that a positive, but the cakes themselves had no taste minus the parts with the frosting. Overall if you want a decent slice of cake that is only help up by it's frosting at $4-5 a slice it's ohk. I'll maybe give them another try for consistency in the future but for now there cake is just mid.
